alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ascension; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:13PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern St. John The Baptist, Ascension, northern St. James, southern Livingston and southern Tangipahoa Parishes through 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Gonzales to 10 miles southeast of Ponchatoula. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gonzales, Donaldsonville, Reserve, Laplace, Ponchatoula, Gramercy, Lutcher, Sorrento, French Settlement, Port Vincent, Springfield, Prairieville, Whitehall, Garyville and Killian. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 171 and 204. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 3 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ascension; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Western Ascension
